data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Quality is great, and the price is right! Good quality switch, and a fraction of the price compared to HomeDepot, and others. I needed just one 4 way, but now have a back up incase I need it!
1#Don’t recommend. The function of the switch is not good ya have to push hard to get it were it needs to be
2#4-way light switches. Installed and work great.
3#4-Way Decorator Wall Light Switches. 4-Way Decorator Wall Light Switches looks great, fits well. Easy to use and easy to take care. Made of durable and sturdy solid steel.
4#Easy to install, switches work perfectly, very good option for double pole setups. Having recently purchased a new house, I have been making some updates and wanted to replace the standard light switches with paddle switches. With a three switch staircase setup, I was looking for a 4-way switch, I was given the chance to try this one from ThunderWay. At first appearance, these switches look great. Installing was super easy and I found that they controlled the lights perfectly. They respond quickly turning on and off and the switch is very smooth with a definitive click into place when turning on and off. My only small criticism, as demonstrated in my video, is that the switch doesn't sit flush on the bottom. There is a little wiggle room that I have not had with other switches that I have installed in my house. It is a very small thing and not something that people would generally notice but it is something that should be improved. (Note: the crooked seating in the video is not due to the switch but rather the electrical box). All-in-all, I think this is a great option if you are in need of a double pole / 4-way switch, especially given the fact you are given 2 switches for under $20. I will probably replace the face plate with a more stylish, screwless option. But for the price and with its functionality, this is a great option.
5#Great set of decorator switches. This is a great set of decorator switches for use in a 3 or 4 way lighting situation. They are made with heavy duty plastic and the back terminals are very easy to use to put your wires into. I would definitely buy these again in the future.
6#No concerns. Initial observation is that these are solid rock switches, everything looks and works as it should, they have their own cover plates so one less thing to buy. They are also UL certified so a piece of mind in installing these around the house.
7#nice dimmer. love having dimmer lights and these were easy to install and look great!
8#Good quality 4-way switch. A 2-way switch connects or disconnects between two terminals. A 3-way switch connects the common terminal to either one of the terminals. A 4-way switch connects or disconnects two pairs of terminals. 4-way switch is needed if more than two switches control one light: two switches should be 3-way and all additional ones should be 4-way. Good switches test no continuity between terminals when disconnected and almost 0 ohms when connected. The 4-way switches looks like good quality upon physical examination. They test perfect functionally, as expected. Overall price is reasonable for two switches with cover plates.
9#Quality 4-way light switch. The THUNDERWAY 4-way light switches come with faceplates and both are well made. They look great and work well. Price is decent too.
10#DANGEROUS! Do not use. My lights started flickering after I installed it (see video). It’s sensitive to touch so there must be loose parts. The wiring diagram is nonsensical with no labels. The drive is not standard Phillips head but appears to be square which means you won’t be able to tighten it properly. Overall this is a fire hazard and Amazon should discontinue sales before someone gets hurt or starts a fire.
11#simple light switches. remodelling the basement and getting rid of the old bakelite switches + the sketchy knob and tube wiring that powered them. wanted something simple since this is a pretty involved job and a light switch doesnt need to be one of complicated parts. ordered this particular style because dogs can turn them off and on! life life is great you train your 4 legged buddies to control the lights and close doors........... until you forget to feed them. Material, size and quality of product are all as expected, they wired in easily and when i said let there be light - the dogs gave it a test drive and it was good.
12#What do needed. These are exactly what I needed. Look nice and also feel like good quality.
13#Light Switches suitable for anywhere. These are more sophisticated light switches - they can be used in multiple switch boxes, or as we did, in just one. It installed easily, looks great and works great - what more could you want?
14#Easy and good looking. This is an affordable way to upgrade the look of your home. No problem swapping out the plates at all.
15#Well made. Well made switches. They are easy to install and look good. They are a good value.
16#Get 2 at bulk-buy price. Our first venture into decorator wall switches over the standard flip ones. These have a nice feel to them. Easy installation, and the price for this 2-pack is cheaper than the big box store for individual units (comparable to the price you'd pay if you were buying them in bulk, without having to).
17#Simple change to modernize your switch. Looks amazing. I got these for my hallway that are a 2way light switches. This kit allows me to continue to use my lights how they are, but update the look to a more modern style, and we don't even use these switches since they are controlled by a smart device. Installing was simple, and did not take long to complete. Was able to attached the cover, and the change is better compared to how they previously looked.
18#Easy grounding screw attachment. This is the first time I've seen a grounding screw wire that you can just easily clamp down instead of making the hook end. These four-way switches have a metal back plane. They are the standard common white color. Typical click noise when switching. They come with screw on single gang cover plates. They can be wired with either push in or side wiring.
19#Pack of 2 light switches and wall plates. This is a two pack of light switches as well as the accompanying wall plates. I switched out our old light switches because they were very old and showing signs of wear and tare. This was a simple job, pull wires off the old switch and place them in the exact same spot on the new switches. It literally took me less than ten minutes to replace each light switch. It helped that these were the exact same color as well. The difference now is that the old ones had dirt and grime as well as being loose when turning the switch on and off. The new switch very audibly "clicks" and is very is also very crisp in its action of pushing the switch on and off. These seem decent for the price they're asking. I woke recommend.
20#Excellent quality 4 way switch with very good price. This are decent quality 4 way switch and comes in 2 pack at very good price. The material and quality is very good and works great also. Comes with cover plate and is good switches. You have to use this 2 of 3 way switch.
21#Good 4-way decora switch. I rewired the lighting in my basement and needed four switch locations. I used 2 of these switches.They worked perfectly. Another reviewer complained about a 'wiring diagram. If you need a wiring diagram perhaps you shouldn't be installing line voltage switches. A simple continuity or ohmmeter will tell you everything you need to for wiring them. The switches themselves are UL listed. They feel like any other 4-way I have used. The wiring screws tightened down well and held. The price point is very good especially if you need cover plates.
22#Good value, nice quality. These are good quality switches. Good value for the price. These are 4 way switches but we're just going to use them as replacement switches in a remodel. My husband the electrician says they great for controlling lights from 3 locations also. They have a good feel when you push them up or down. The switch plates are full size, covering the not perfect cutout for the switch.
23#Read the reviews - make sure this is the right switch for you! IN the middle of a major home remodel and the electrician suggested a "4-way switch" which actually allows us to control a bank of lights from three locations. Found this on Amazon and he gave the thumbs up. They are going to be installed next week with the majority of the new switches and outlets, but he just looked at them and said they were great - just what he needed. I'll let him do the hard work with the wiring, etc. But I do like the look and feel of the cover plate and the rocker switch itself. As always, lean on the reviews before going in blindly. I am very pleased with this product.
24#Much better price than big box stores. 4 Way switches aren't very common, and the ones in the big box stores are a lot more expensive. If you need only one, i would get one from a big box store since they are about $8, but if you need two and plates, this is a better deal. These are also UL listed and commercial grade so they should have no problem being approved in a project.
25#These seem like typical residential quality switches of this type. "Four way" switches are used when you have three or more switches controlling one load. These oddly named units from China look and feel much like the lower cost tier ones you can find at local building supply stores. So far they are working fine, but in the future I honestly will stick to buying premium grade units from well-known brands. The labor of changing these things out is more consequential than the purchase cost, so take that into account in your decision.
26#Good Quality. I quickly replaced my old ivory colored toggle style 4 way switches with these nice-looking decorator style switches. Wiring is simple, just pay attention to which terminals are marked in and out as they may have a different orientation to your existing switches. You can clamp your wire ends pushed in straight under the screw terminal, which I must believe is safer than the stab in kind, or you can secure them wrapped under the screw head in the traditional way. The switch has a nice positive click to it, and the cover plate is of good quality, though I prefer the kind with the hidden screws. Easily comparable to the big box store offerings.
27#Works well. I got these switches for my home just installed one for my kitchen and it works as it should install was simple I just cut the power before for safety. I ended up using the frame from my old switch which is clip on because the ones it comes with would not work for me because of the quartz backsplash to thick screws would not reach.
28#Not a good feeling switch. A 4-way switch means that you can turn on and off the light from 3 different locations (not 4). If you think about it, a normal one location switch is 2-way (on or off). This one installs and wires like any normal 4-way switch (they provide a wiring diagram on the box), but when you press it to switch it on or off it makes a loud clicking sound and the motion is gritty, like it's going through multiple contacts to reach the final stop. It is possible to leave it in a partially-on position, which is not good. I don't like how it feels and it doesn't give me confidence, but it does work. It is UL listed.
29#Same Quality as the Name Brands. These switches are the same quality as the big boys. They can be backwired. They have a strip gauge. They have a metal strap that run the entire back of the switch, etc... They are UL listed. I don't expect to have any problems with them.
30#Wiring diagram isn't what I wa expecting. Wiring 4 way switches is akin to doing advanced calculus!!! I have done numerouse 4 way switches in the past and every time the wiring paths are a mind bender. I am used to a 4 way being labeled as in and out as either the top two terminals are in and bottom out or one side is in and the other out. I didn't see these as being labeled but interestingly enough as I am looking at the pictures for this review, I now see on the back way at the bottom it say IN on one side and Out on the other. As for the switch. It is a good switch. Seems well made. It isn't a silent switch but not really loud either. Just a normal switch sound when you push it. Getting two for the price is a good deal. Comes with basic plates that work but nothing special.
31#Nice 4-way Decorative Switches. There's not too much to say about a switch, either it works or it doesn't. These 4-way switches work fine. The connections are solid. The rocker function "clicks" well when pressed. You can pay a lot for a 4-way switch. This two-pack represents a good value in 4-way switches.
